course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Introductory Chemistry
course.description: This course targets science or engineering students with very little to no chemistry background. It provides a general introduction to basic principles of chemistry. Key topics include state of matters, atoms and elements, molecules and compounds, atomic structures and periodicity, molecular structures, quantities in chemical reactions, bonding theories, acids and bases, and solution chemistry. Students without HKDSE qualifications may seek instructor's approval for enrolment.
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Chemistry OR HKDSE 1x Chemistry, any CHEM courses at or above 1004-level, CORE 1120

reviews.author: NORMAL_PERSON
reviews.title: Good intro CHEM course for no chem background pp
reviews.comment_content:
List of Topics:
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium( This sem is cutted)

P.S I am no chem background sudent and my chem is trouble in junior high school but I really learn something in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof teach quite ok for me and I can catch up with her talking speed.
Although she is basically just follow to slides,she explain those terms clearly.Sometimes, she will do experiment in class which is quite interesting for me.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:

Online Quiz 1 (10%)
Online Quiz 2 (10%)
Offline Mid Term (40%)
Offline Final Exam (40%)

Online Quiz 1: Mean: 59.31/75 Median: 63.5/75 High: 75/75 Upper Quartile: 67.5/75 Low: 0/75 Lower Quartile: 55/75

Online Quiz 2: Mean: 35.12/45 Median: 38/45 High: 45/45 Upper Quartile: 41/45 Low: 0/45 Lower Quartile: 31/45

Most of the questions are MCs and some of them are SQs
The quiz is quite basic and similar to the exercises so the scores are competitive

Offline Mid Term: Mean: 26.45/40 Median: 27/40 High: 39/40 Upper Quartile: 31/40 Low: 0/40 Lower Quartile: 22/40

The mid term is 40 MCs which cover Chp 1-6
It is also similar to the exercises

Offline Final Exam: Mean: 63.71/100 Median: 69.5/100 High: 94/100 Upper Quartile: 79.88/100 Low: 0/100  Lower Quartile: 51.25/100
The Final Exam is 25 MCs(50%) 4 LQs(50%)(drawing lewis structure molarity cal etc.) which cover Chp 7-11

It is also similar to the exercises

For me:
Online Quiz 1: 62.5/75
Online Quiz 2: 44/45
Offline Mid Term: 34/40
Offline Final Exam: 81/5/100
Overall 84.71/100-->A

I would say the grading is quite fair as this course is basic chem and all concept is basic even you don't have chem background so this course is very hard to get A+ cuz I think you need to almost get full  marks in all quizzes and exams but if you aim B or A range,it is possible for you to get it even you have no chem background.All you need to do is to be careful and hard work to prepare all the quizzes and exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is ok? I would say as there are only two quizzes(three weeks before each exams) and mid term final which is basic ust course.Prof. also release some exercises which are not needed to submit but those questions are very similar to quizzes and exames so it is recommended to do those exercises.

Aim A then workload will be C D E
Aim pass then workloar will be A
so overload b
hope you can get great grade in this course <3

reviews.author: lme
reviews.title: Beginner Friendly Course
reviews.comment_content:
Beginner friendly content. Super easy even you have zero chemistry knowledge.

Midterm syllabus
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
-----------------------------------------------------------
Final syllabus
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium (skipped)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Tsang always tries her best to make things clear for us and i think she really did a great job. As a beginner, I was able to understand every single concepts, not to mention the fact I actually know nothing about chemistry.

Some fun experiment demonstrations, prof will do some in class questions with us so that we can grasp the concepts clearly. Little interaction between prof and students though so it may be a bit boring when it comes to highly theoretical stuff.

No attendance taking, you can skip lectures and watch the recordings cuz there were a lot of students kept talking and it was kinda distracting
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 (10%): 64/75    Mean:59.3/75
Quiz 2 (10%): 30/45    Mean:35/45
Midterm(40%): 30/40   Mean:26.9/40
Final (40%): 62.5/100  Mean:64.5/100
Final Grade: B-

Bad grading honestly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Super light
Only 2 quizzes, midterm and final.
Some exercise for practice but they are optional.

reviews.author: Cynthia_halo
reviews.title: Easy and fun
reviews.comment_content:
ONLY for students with no chemistry background, it starts from the very beginner level.
Be careful about the provided page in the mid-term or exam. Some information such as the VSEPR shape names was absent in my final exam, so you must memorize them!
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear and informative, you can ask Professor TSANG questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading: As this is an easy course, many students can get above 70% of the mark, so you must be perfect in tests to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, 2 quizzes, 1 mid-term, and 1 final exam.

reviews.author: Kyrant
reviews.comment_content: i have no chem background so this wasnt great but content was alright, may be a bit hard to grasp at first so just do the practises or go on youtube or something
reviews.comment_teaching: great teacher, clear explanations, little bit of humour here and there
reviews.comment_grading:
2 quizzes (10% each) both open book and the midterm and final (both 40%)
quiz 1: 61/75 mean 59.3
quiz 2: 31/45 mean 35.1
midterm: 31/40 mean 26.5
final: 67/100 mean 63.7
final grade: B
you could probably catch up to the tryhards / people who dropped chemistry if you work hard enough, i wasnt about to do that so yeah

reviews.author: smart llama
reviews.title: Could be a hard course for students with no chem background
reviews.comment_content: Content of the course has been mentioned in other comments for many times. So I gonna not repeat. However, the scope of the course is quite broad. It might be difficult for beginners to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Tsang was able to explain concepts clearly. (probably because I studied them in secondary school.)

Online Quiz 1 (10%): 72/75   Mean: 59.3

Midterm (40%): 37/40            Mean: 26.9      SD: 6.13

Online Quiz 2 (10%): 41/45   Mean: 35.1

Final (40%): 89/100               Mean: 64.5      SD: 19.2

Overall: 91.31% (A+)

It seems that you need to get overall 90% for an A+.

p.s. I studied chemistry in F4 and F5, and I dropped at F6 :)
reviews.comment_workload: Besides midterm and final, there are two online quizzes. One in late September and one in mid November. Review Exercises are posted for revision.

reviews.author: hytyy
reviews.comment_content: Very basic knowledge of chemistry . Quite easy even you didn't study chemistry before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not bad, if you don't want to attend the lecture you may watch the recordings or just read the powerpoint. She provides some review exercises, I think finishing them would be more useful than attending the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade, I get only 87% overall and the grade is A. (Around top10-12%)
Grading is based on quizzes 20%,mid term exam 40% ,final exam 40%, no attendance
reviews.comment_workload: light workload. No homework , only 2 online quizzes and 2 exams . Only MC questions in mid term exam. MC+short questions in final exam.

reviews.author: An225 Mriya
reviews.title: Around 1/3 of the DSE Chemistry Curriculum
reviews.comment_content:
As some background, I never take Chemistry in high school, though I did take Physics and its extension module 2, and have a satisfactory result in HKDSE. Some parts, particularly Chapter 1 and the first part of Chapter 7 interlap with that of DSE Physics.

The contents of CHEM1008 are as follows:
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table (2 chapters)
↳Covers the Bohr and quantum mechanics model
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium
*Though stated in the introduction, Chapter 12 was never released, taught and examined.

The contents were generally easy, though if you are not Science/Engineering students, do spend more time in understanding the theories and calculations. For MECH/AE students, parts of Chapter 7 related to the quantum mechanics model are also related to and taught in the beginning of MECH2410.

Despite all of the contents, this is only a very limited part of elementary chemistry for university studies. Particularly, contents like reaction rate, enthalpy (in which enthalpy changes in reactions are always given in questions) and organic chemistry are largely untouched. If you find HKDSE Chemistry papers for revision, you would quickly find yourself overwhelmed.

All in all, if you only want to use it to satisfy common core, all is well and good. If you want to use CHEM1008 to get yourself into CHEM1020/1030, you would probably be outperformed by those who studied chemistry in HKDSE.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Emily Tsang is a local professor who grown up in Canada, and is conversant in fluent Cantonese and English with a sweet voice. Her teaching is generally clear (after all, its a elementary course on chemistry with simple concepts), and she is willing to answer your questions after lectures.

As a really large class with around 200 people, in-class interactions between Professor Tsang and students were minimal. She did performed some simple experiments in lectures. If you want to see them, do grab a seat in front of the lecture hall!

While there were also TAs in the course, they didn't make appearance until the final revision tutorials. As I didn't attend them, I cannot comment more on them.
reviews.comment_grading:
*Online quizzes: 20%
**Quiz 1: 10% (70/75, mean 59.31/75, median 63.5/75, highest 75/75)
**Quiz 2: 10% (41.2/45, mean 35.12/45, median 38/45, highest 45/45)
*Midterm exam: 40% (37/40, mean 26.435/40, median 27/40, highest 39/40)
*Final exam: 40% (93/100, mean 63.71/100, median 69.5/100, highest 94/100)

The open-book online quizzes were done on Canvas, and have a time limit of 2-2.5 hours, making them essentially big assignments. Questions are generally easy, though always prepare for some harder questions.

The closed-book midterm exam only comes with MC questions, while the also closed-book final exam has 25 MC questions and short/long questions, each consisting half of the exam. The MC questions are generally straightforward, while for the short/long questions, don't bet everything on calculation questions: there were around 10-20% of conceptual questions that could downgrade a student with insufficient preparation.

At the end get an A+ for the course, which is satisfactory for my performance. While previous reviews reported a not-that-high A-range, it turns out that it's not that hard to achieve excellence in the course's limited assessments.
reviews.comment_workload:
Minimal.

Practice exercises are released per 1-2 chapters, though they are not graded. You are although strongly recommended to complete them for your online quizzes and exams.

Online quizzes were announced one-week before its deadline. As their time limit are so generous, they can be essentially treated as big assignments. Most of the workload was therefore spent on preparing the midterms and finals. From my experience, doing around 80% of the practice exercises and a few selected HKDSE MC questions are sufficient for preparing for the exams.

reviews.author: Dixon_Ho
reviews.comment_content:
Topic
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium(This topic appeared in the course outline, but the instructor didn't teach this topic, of course it didn't appear in the final exam)

Most of the topics are easy to understand(especially ch.1-6), ch.7-12 may feel a little harder compare with the previous chapter(ch.7 has two parts, and the first part is about physics, you may need to  put more effort on it if you didn't study physics before)
reviews.comment_teaching: Emily Tsang is a very good instructor, she explains everything clearly and having a clear pronunciation. She can speak in both English and Cantonese.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quizzes (2 x 10% each)  20%
In-class Midterm Exam  40%
In-class Final Exam  40%

Online quizzes are open book and you finish them on Canvas
Midterm exam is all MC questions
Final exam' format is MC questions & Short Answers (i.e., fill-in-the blanks, structure drawing, calculations, etc)
reviews.comment_workload: Almost zero workload, there are only two online quizzes, midterm exam and final exam. No assignments are needed to hand-in. There are some exercises you can do for practise.

No Assigment need to submit and not grade.
But have some assigments provide.

reviews.author: 你好嗎
reviews.title: Easy course, requires you with high carefulness to get high marks/grades
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy as long as you don’t skip any lessons or read the PowerPoint on your own. Basic chemistry stuff in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good teacher!! Explain everything very clearly! Clear pronunciation. She I nows Cantonese so you can ask her questions in Cantonese after class if you don’t understand something.
reviews.comment_grading: I would say it is hard to get good grades as everyone get high marks (close to full mark). Therefore, you have to be extra careful to get high marks to have A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: You will have 2 open-book quizzes for 20% in total. And that’s it. You don’t other things to do except these 2.

reviews.author: Elephant
reviews.title: Good professor and easy course
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Tsang is very nice and explains the concepts really well. She basically relies on the slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two quizzes, one before the midterm and one after the midterm. The content for the final exam is non-cumulative.

- Online Quizzes (2 x 10% each) 20% (Open book, some MC, some short questions)
- In-class Midterm Exam 40% (All MC)
- In-class Final Exam 40% (Some MC, some short questions)

Quiz 1: 67.5/75 (Mean: 58, High: 75)
Midterm: 35/40 (Mean: 25.97, High: 40)
Quiz 2: 41/45 (Mean: 35.16, High: 45)
Final: 88/100 (Mean: 61.56, High: 93)

I am above upper quartile for all except Quiz 2 and got A eventually. I believe that the proportion for A range is quite small for this course. But it is still a good and useful course overall.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment, two quizzes, one midterm and a final exam only. You just have to keep up the pace and do some exercises on the topics, then you should be able to handle them!

reviews.author: Tricia
reviews.comment_content:
1. Matter and Energy - the chart of matter
2. Atoms and Elements - definitions of basic chem terms, intro to periodic table
3. Molecules and Compounds - chemical formula (a recipe to make a compound)
4. Chemical Composition - learn to use molar mass, Avogadro's number
5. Chemical Reactions - chemical equation
6. Reaction Stoichiometry - a recipe

7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table - bohr model, QM model, trends in periodic table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures - Lewis structure, VSEPR model, electronegativity & polarity
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces - 4 types of intermolecular forces
10. Solution Chemistry - solute, solvent, why salt dissolves in water, solution concentration, titration, boiling point elevation & freezing point depression
11. Acids and Bases - acid + base, acid + metal / metal oxide, pH value
reviews.comment_teaching: has a clear explanation, very easy to understand. is very helpful if you have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 10%
Midterms: 40%
Finals: 40%
reviews.comment_workload: very light workload, no homework, only quizzes.

reviews.author: Thanks
reviews.comment_content: Just basic high school content. There are different worksheets for you to practice with answer and no need to submit. This can help you to prepare your midterm and final exam which is useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Clear English and provide different experience demo in class to explain.
She willing to answer student questions in class and after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite fair. Both two quizzes and midterm I got around 5 ％ higher than the mean.
Final just 1 or 2 mark higher than the mean.
And I got B.
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance needed. It provide video recording and PowerPoint on canvas.
There total 2 quizzes and one in class midterm and final exam.
That 2 quizzes can finish at your own time around 1.5 hours just finish it within 3 days will be fine.

reviews.author: Ayumi
reviews.comment_content: Most of the topics covered in the DSE. The content itself is not difficult if you review the lecture ppt slides and regularly practice exercises to ensure that you understand the material. Additionally, there are some calculations that you need to practice.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor explains the topic very clearly and in an easy-to-understand manner. I can easily follow the topic and will not get lost.
reviews.comment_grading: It seems like many people are able to handle this class, therefore, you might need to achieve a relatively high mark to obtain a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments are marked. You can do them if you want. There are also online quizzes and two exams

Matter and Energy

Atoms and Elements

Molecules and Compounds
Chapter 4. Chemical Composition
Chapter 4. Chemical Composition
Chemical Composition

reviews.comment_teaching: Past papers are not provided. Generally, she taught at a relatively slow pace. It is okay to self-learn and review the lecture videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 10%
Midterms: 40%
Finals: 40%
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload with no homework. Revise for the online quizzes and do more practices given by her.

reviews.author: Clinton
reviews.title: CHEM 1008 REVIEW
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty Basic Chemistry.
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
reviews.comment_teaching: Miss Tsang speaks very clearly during lectures. She explains concepts in a way where most people can understand, which is remarkable compared to lecturers in other courses. She is definitely the best lecturer I've ever met in this entire semester. Solid A tier.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 10%
Midterms: 40%
Finals: 40%

My grades
Quiz 1: 71/75
Quiz 2: 42/45
Midterms: 25/40 (Mean: 26.2/40, SD: 6.5)
Finals: 93/100 (Mean: 62.2/100, SD: 18.6)
Total: 81/100
Grade: B+
Really fair grading if you ask me. I could've gotten A if I didn't choke in midterms. Beware the midterms, they mess up your grades.
reviews.comment_workload: VERY low workload. Just do 2 quizzes in the entire semester. However, I highly recommend doing the exercises, which do not count to the grade, on Canvas. They helped me a lot for the finals.

reviews.author: Leoml
reviews.comment_content:
Covers the basics of chemistry
Mainly about unit conversion.
including:
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good, the motivations behind the principles and the logic of unit conversion are often clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
 Online Quizzes (2 x 10% each) 20%
 In-class Midterm Exam 40%, (consist of only MCs)
 In-class Final Exam 40%
(consist of MCs and long Qs)

Normal grading.
FYI:
Quiz 1: 75/75
Quiz 2: 42/45
(Mean is around 80%)
Midterm: 35/40 (Mean 26.2, SD 6.5)
Final: 86/100 (Mean 62.2, SD 18.6)
Grade: A
Both midterm and final are easy.
To get A+, you need to score almost highest and be very careful.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light. As the content is simple, it is not hard to go through the content for revision. The quizzes and the review exercises are also simple.
Make sure you are clear with the logic of unit conversion.

reviews.author: Fai Ching
reviews.title: OK Garde Easy Course
reviews.comment_content: Basic Chem knowledge, should be very easy if you have some chem background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Emily is a good professor, has a good accent and is clear. Also have some funny experiment during the lecture like CO2 Dry Ice experiment .
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say it is a good grade because I did not study much for this course.
2 Online Quizzes, 10% per one.
Midterm Exam 40%
Final Exam 40%

Midterm are all MC questions, the questions are not very easy but for other peoples as well.

For the final exam, the long question is quite similar to the review exercises, it is not hard to get a passing grade with it.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low, it only has 2 canvas quizzes, you will have a week to finish it. The quizzes are not very hard, and they are open books, so you can google your question.

For the lecture, no attendance, so you can just skip the lecture and watch the recording and ppt if you have some chem background,

reviews.author: Christian_Chow
reviews.title: Good course for secondary school level chemistry fundamental knowledge
reviews.comment_content:
1. Matter and Energy - the chart of matter
2. Atoms and Elements - definitions of basic chem terms, intro to periodic table
3. Molecules and Compounds - chemical formula (a recipe to make a compound)
4. Chemical Composition - learn to use molar mass, Avogadro's number
5. Chemical Reactions - chemical equation
6. Reaction Stoichiometry - a recipe

7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table - bohr model, QM model, trends in periodic table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures - Lewis structure, VSEPR model, electronegativity & polarity
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces - 4 types of intermolecular forces
10. Solution Chemistry - solute, solvent, why salt dissolves in water, solution concentration, titration, boiling point elevation & freezing point depression
11. Acids and Bases - acid + base, acid + metal / metal oxide, pH value

12. Chemical Equilibrium (cancelled)
reviews.comment_teaching: Good professor. Good lecture videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not yet released. Not friendly to chemistry beginner. The mean is very high in this course

Quiz 1: 0/75 (mean 58 median 59.5 UQ 64.63)
Quiz 2: 30/45 (mean 35.16 median 37)
Final exam: 81.5/100 (mean 61.56 median 62.5 UQ 76.5)
Midterm Exam: 23/40  (mean 25.97 median 26)
Grade: C
reviews.comment_workload:
qVery light.

2 online quiz + mid term + final

My suggested approach to this course:
just stick to the schedule of this course weekly. don't fall behind the schedule at the start. mark the important dates on your calendar. don't let things build up in the middle of the semester

reviews.author: kiu328
reviews.comment_content: As an introductory course, it covers the basic principles of chemistry in a clear and concise manner, which is perfect for science or engineering students with little to no chemistry background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since the content is not that difficult, the instructor read the ppt and may add some explanation. There are RVC videos to see.
reviews.comment_grading: The assignments and exams were fair and covered the material adequately.
reviews.comment_workload: With only two quizzes, one midterm exam, and one final exam, the course workload seems reasonable and manageable. And the quizzes are open-book.

reviews.author: yxwu
reviews.title: Very Good Course

具体我忘了
反正很简单，我基本上只是暑假的时候预习过一点，然后平时偶尔看一下，零基础零workload拿A

very good
very patient
very clear

online quiz1 10%
online quiz2 10%
midterm 40%
final 40%

me:
quiz1: 69/75
quiz2: 37/40
midterm: 31/40
final:around84(我不记得了）/100。~ above1.2 sd
letter grade: A
我要为这门课正名，好grade且简单
reviews.comment_workload: zero workload

reviews.author: Darrin
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium (Cancelled due to lack of teaching time)

The content is easy generally (As I have studied DSE Chem before, but dropped at Form 6 so that I can study this course). If you pay attention to her teaching and read the ppt thoroughly, you can certainly get a good grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: As it is an introductory course, I think that prof. Emily has done a great job in teaching because the content is very easy for her. (Just like it is hard for a form 6 students to teach a primary kid addition and subtraction). She explained the ppt in detail and the pace is quite slow so that it is easy for people that with no chem background to follow. But one bad thing is better do not use email to ask questions because you will need to use few days to wait for response which is quite annoying. Maybe just ask questions after lecture will be good, she will explain in details which is quite good.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it is easy to get a A- and A even if you did not study Chem before, but A+ is super difficult to get. All you have to do is read the ppt, understand the content and study the ppt. Also be familiar with in-class exercise because similar question will appear in mid-term or final. Remember to finish the review exercise because it is extremely useful.

My grade:
Online quiz 1 (Open-book) [10%]: 70.5/75
Online quiz 2 (Open-book) [10%]: 37/40
Mid-term (MC only) [40%]: 35/40
Final (MC and LQ) [40%]: 88.5/100

Final score: 89.1/100 (Grade: A)
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, you can even don't attend the lecture but I suggest you to watch back the recording. Other than lecture, there is no HWs. The review exercise is optional but very useful.

reviews.author: 清水灣廢青
reviews.title: Bad Grade Easy Course with low workload
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus see others
Very Easy and Basic Chem.
Not much reciting needed as important info are provided in exam e.g., formulas, periodic table, solubility rules. (Which saves lots of workload)
reviews.comment_teaching: Good english accent. Sometime struggles when explaining. Overall not hard to follow even under 2x speed.
reviews.comment_grading:
Honestly quite bad grade.
Please don't say you get almost highest and A+ then it is gd grade course, rly on99 logic. Good/Bad grade shd be determined by the grading curve (e.g. how many % ppl get A/B/C range).

For me
2 Quiz (20%): above median (most gets similar scores, close to 85%)
MT (40%): 31/40 (LQ 22 median 27 UQ 31)
Final (40%): 82.5/100 (LQ 54 median 68 UQ 77.5 Mean 66 SD 15.4)
Resulting grade: B+. In final i get 1.1 SD above mean still B range, thus bad grade course. I guess my total score i should be around 18-20th percentile.

So it implies she gives less than 20% A range, which UST suggests 20-25%. Real good grade course could give even high as 30%.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very low. No assignment. Canvas Quizzes (2hr each, usually done in 1 weekend at anytime) are open-book and can google ans quite easily.

Suggested approach: skip all lect then 2x speed watch Lect Video. If hv time and review again. I just watched once without doing any practice Qs.

reviews.author: tonii
reviews.title: Good course for people talented in Chemistry but didn't choose it in DSE
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus: (read the other posts)
If your was good at Chemistry in Secondary 3 but end up didn't choose Chemistry, this course is very suitable for you and you can get easily a nice grade.
If you got Level 2 or below in DSE Chemistry, which means you are not talented in Chemistry, don't choose this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Tsang's accent and pronunciation are very easy for people to understand.
She is willing to answer students' questions.
She sometimes ends the lecture early.
However, I don't recommend you attend the lectures. The two reasons are as follows:
The students there are very noisy.
In every lecture, she gave us 10 minutes to solve a problem and used 5 minutes to explain but the problem can usually be solved within a minute.
So I'd recommend watching the lecture videos instead.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quiz 1: 10%
Online Quiz 2: 10%
Midterm: 40%
Final: 40%
Midterm consists of MCQ.
Final consists of MCQ and short questions.
Note that midterm and final are equally important.
My score:
Online Quiz 1: 75/75
Online Quiz 2: 39/40
Midterm: 37/40
Final: 91.5/100
Grade: A+
I don't see any reason to say this course is 爛龜(bad grade).
Just have a bigger brain.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload, only 2 online quizzes.
There are 7 exercises for you to practise. If you aim for a nice grade, I'd recommend finishing them.

reviews.author: LSJU
reviews.title: A bit challenging for local students
reviews.comment_content:
Basic chemistry knowledge. The depth is not deep, but there is some breadth and a lot of content covered.
Chapter 1 Matter and Energy
Matter and Energy
Chapter 2 Atoms and Elements
Atoms and Elements
Chapter 3 Molecules and Compounds
Molecules and Compounds
Chapter 4. Chemical Composition
Chapter 4. Chemical Composition
Chemical Composition
Chapter 5. Chemical Reactions
Chemical Reactions
Chapter 6. Reaction Stoichiometry
Reaction Stoichiometry
Chapter 7 Electrons in Atom and the Periodic Table
Electrons in Atoms and the Periodic Table (PART I)
Attachment
Electrons in Atoms and the Periodic Table (PART II)
Chapter 8 Chemical Bonding
Chapter 8 Chemical Bonding
Chapter 9 Solids, Liquids, and Intermolecular Forces
Chapter 9 Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
Chapter 10 Properties of Solutions
Chapter 10 Properties of Solutions
Chapter 11 Acids and Bases
Acids and Bases
Due to time constraints, we ended up with one less chapter.
Although I had studied chemistry for four years before but I still learn something new. Because the scope of this course is very broad.
So there may be some challenges for students who have no chemistry foundation at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's explanation was not bad; clear and understandable. But there are always students who do not listen carefully (this class does not count attendance, can students who do not listen to the lecture get out of the classroom?)
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grades.
Online Quizzes (2 x 10% each) 20%
In-class Midterm Exam 40%
In-class Final Exam 40%
I was probably in the top four percent and ended up with an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework, only two quizzes. No workload.

reviews.author: someonehateust
reviews.title: 幾容易讀但係唔算好grade
reviews.comment_content:
1. Matter and Energy
2. Atoms and Elements
3. Molecules and Compounds
4. Chemical Composition
5. Chemical Reactions
6. Reaction Stoichiometry
7. Atomic Structures and the Periodic Table
8. Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structures
9. Liquids, Solids, and Intermolecular Forces
10. Solution Chemistry
11. Acids and Bases
12. Chemical Equilibrium
第7課有D phy 野講下bohr model 個D 同electron configuration
reviews.comment_teaching:
照powerpoint 講，唔係特別有用，可以自己睇，同埋有upload d 片上去canvas ，唔明可以上網再睇翻。
有比D exercise 我地做，做完容易D明concept 建議做曬佢
mid term 同online quizzes 個D卷可以去佢office搵佢睇翻，唔會派比我地
reviews.comment_grading:
唔係幾好grade , above mean 0.6 sd 都係得b(以為有b+

2 online quizzes 分別佔10%
mid-term 40%
final 40%
mid-term 40 marks 40 mc 1 hr 30 min
final 50 percent mc 50 short question
short question 個到好多計數大概35分都係 其他有寫electron configuration 同埋畫Chemical Bonding個D
reviews.comment_workload: 小，only quizzes and exams , no any assignments 如果有D底子應該review 下個powerpoint 就得，唔take attendace， canvas 有 錄影可以睇翻所以唔去都得

reviews.author: someoneinusthi
reviews.comment_content: The content gives an adequate introduction to the general key concepts of chemistry. It is suitable for anyone with little to no background in chemistry. Topics that are covered include states of matter, atomic and molecular structures, elements, periodicity, quantities in chemical reactions, bonding theories, acids, bases, and solutions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Taking into account that this is a new course, the professor still manages to present and teach well while providing adequate information and resources to students. Prof. Tsang always comes in with a smile and a very bright mood during lectures. She is also very willing to answer questions. Interesting demos and examples are also given during class. The class is never boring even though it is just going through powerpoint slides.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading only consists of quizzes and exams.
reviews.comment_workload: So far the workload has been very manageable. The flexibility of how we study the course allows students to manage how they study the course. There is no required homework regularly. The only thing needed is to review the presentations posted. Ungraded review exercises are also given to students, which are very helpful.

reviews.author: samuelcps
reviews.title: A great introduction course to chemistry
reviews.comment_content: The easy version of the whole A level Chemistry (Hong Kong), and add a bit of new stuffs in it
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing special, the lecturer just teaches what the powerpoint slides showed, but its clear and easy  enough for people who do not have good foundation in chemistry. It would serve as a great introductory course to people studying in Secondary school, or to those who have not touch upon chemistry in university.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you have done some basic revision, it is almost impossible to get a bad grade. But in the final exam, it could be crushing hard. Yet, if you have done all assignment seriously, it won't affect your grade immensely.
reviews.comment_workload: one worksheet for each topic + one quiz + one final exam, the workload is definitely not heavy.
